static char __pyx_doc_6PMMoTo_10medialAxis_16medialExtraction__compute_thin_image[] = "Compute a thin image.\n\n    Loop through the image multiple times, removing \"simple\" points, i.e.\n    those point which can be removed without changing local connectivity in the\n    3x3x3 neighborhood of a point.\n\n    This routine implements the two-pass algorithm of [Lee94]_. Namely,\n    for each of the six border types (positive and negative x-, y- and z-),\n    the algorithm first collects all possibly deletable points, and then\n    performs a sequential rechecking.\n\n    The input, `img`, is assumed to be a 3D binary image in the\n    (p, r, c) format [i.e., C ordered array], filled by zeros (background) and\n    ones. \n\n    ";

 056:     """Compute a thin image.
 057: 
 058:     Loop through the image multiple times, removing "simple" points, i.e.
 059:     those point which can be removed without changing local connectivity in the
 060:     3x3x3 neighborhood of a point.
 061: 
 062:     This routine implements the two-pass algorithm of [Lee94]_. Namely,
 063:     for each of the six border types (positive and negative x-, y- and z-),
 064:     the algorithm first collects all possibly deletable points, and then
 065:     performs a sequential rechecking.
 066: 
 067:     The input, `img`, is assumed to be a 3D binary image in the
 068:     (p, r, c) format [i.e., C ordered array], filled by zeros (background) and
 069:     ones.
 070: 
 071:     """

static char __pyx_doc_6PMMoTo_10medialAxis_16medialExtraction_2_compute_thin_image_surface[] = "Compute a thin image.\n\n    Loop through the image multiple times, removing \"simple\" points, i.e.\n    those point which can be removed without changing local connectivity in the\n    3x3x3 neighborhood of a point.\n\n    This routine implements the two-pass algorithm of [Lee94]_. Namely,\n    for each of the six border types (positive and negative x-, y- and z-),\n    the algorithm first collects all possibly deletable points, and then\n    performs a sequential rechecking.\n\n    The input, `img`, is assumed to be a 3D binary image in the\n    (p, r, c) format [i.e., C ordered array], filled by zeros (background) and\n    ones. \n\n    ";

 135:     """Compute a thin image.
 136: 
 137:     Loop through the image multiple times, removing "simple" points, i.e.
 138:     those point which can be removed without changing local connectivity in the
 139:     3x3x3 neighborhood of a point.
 140: 
 141:     This routine implements the two-pass algorithm of [Lee94]_. Namely,
 142:     for each of the six border types (positive and negative x-, y- and z-),
 143:     the algorithm first collects all possibly deletable points, and then
 144:     performs a sequential rechecking.
 145: 
 146:     The input, `img`, is assumed to be a 3D binary image in the
 147:     (p, r, c) format [i.e., C ordered array], filled by zeros (background) and
 148:     ones.
 149: 
 150:     """
